General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Salaried Benefit Structure
Career Average Pay Formula
For certain individuals who were members or salaried employees as of June 30, 1990, a monthly
pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2007: Benefit accrued as of December 31, 2006.
ii. Service after 12/31/2006: Same as Final Average Pay Formula.
Minimum Benefit Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2007: $26.00 multiplied by the period, in years and months, during which
benefits were accrued under this benefit structure including, if the member joined within two months
of his first becoming eligible, that additional period during which he would have accrued benefits but
for the age and/or service requirements for eligibility to enter this benefit structure, plus 150% of the
benefit attributable to employee contributions to any prior plan.
ii. Service after 12/31/2006: Same as Final Average Pay Formula.
Early Retirement Pension
Final Average Pay Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the final average pay formula (or under the
minimum benefit formula, if greater) based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2007, either (i) with no
reduction, if benefits commence at or after age 62 or (ii) reduced by 2-1/2% for each year between age
62 and the date of commencement of benefits, if benefits commence prior to age 62.
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement based on service accrued after December 31, 2006,
reduced by 4.8% for each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits.
Career Average Pay Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the career average pay formula (or under the
minimum benefit formula, if greater) based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2007, with no
reduction if the sum of a member's age and service (his points) equals or exceeds the required number
of points at each age as specified below:
Attained Age Required Attained Age Required
Last Birthday Points Last Birthday Points
55 85 60 80
56 84 61 76
57 83 62 72
58 82 63 68
59 81 64 69
If these point requirements are not met, the accrued benefit based on service accrued prior to
January 1, 2007 will be payable either (i) commencing at normal retirement date or (ii) commencing
immediately and reduced by the lesser of (1) 2-1/2% times the number of points by which age plus
service are less than those required, or (2) 2-1/2% for each year between age 65 and the date of
commencement of benefits.
5

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Salaried Benefit Structure
In addition, if the early retirement benefit based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2007 is payable
under the career average pay formula and commences prior to age 62, a temporary monthly
supplemental benefit is payable between early retirement date and age 62, or earlier death, equal to
$1.50 per year of service as a member between October 1, 1956, and the date of retirement. No
additional benefit accrues after June 30, 1990. This temporary benefit is reduced by the same factor as
for the accrued benefit above, if applicable.
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement based on service accrued after December 31, 2006,
reduced by 4.8% for each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits, after
completion of 10 years of continuous service, or reduced on an actuarial equivalent basis before
completion of 10 years of continuous service.
Available Forms of Payment
Normal form of payment is a single life annuity. Optional forms of payment also available on an actuarial
equivalent basis are the 10 year certain and life annuity; and 50% and 100% contingent annuities. For
portion of benefit accrued prior to January 1, 2007, level income at 62 and 65 options are also available
on an actuarial equivalent basis.
Employee Contributions
No employee contributions are required on or after January 1, 1982.
Termination
If terminating employment after completion of five years of continuous service, the accrued normal
retirement pension is payable commencing at age 65. The benefit may commence prior to age 65 on an
actuarial equivalent basis if early retirement requirements are satisfied; in no event is an amount less
than the member's own contributions with regular interest returned.
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse, the surviving spouse will be entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had
the member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 100% contingent annuitant option.
Death After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected; in any event, the excess, if any, of the death benefit payable
just prior to retirement over actual pension payments is paid to the beneficiary.
Pension Enhancement
Certain members employed prior to January 1, 1999, and retiring from active service will be entitled to a
pension enhancement benefit of $94 per month, prorated for less than 10 years of continuous service at
retirement, commencing at age 65. An additional benefit, in the same amount, will be payable when an
eligible spouse attains age 65.
If a member was employed prior to January 1, 1999, and terminates with a deferred vested benefit, the
pension enhancement benefit will be reduced by the ratio of the member's years of service at
termination to the years of service he would have had at age 65.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Salaried Benefit Structure
For members at the Armament Non-Represented, Camden Salaried, ATP Salaried, GDIT, Corporate
Office and Shared Resources segments, the pension enhancement benefit is frozen as of
December 31, 2013. For members at the OTS Garland Salaried segment, the pension enhancement
benefit is frozen as of December 31, 2017. For members at the NASSCO Salaried and NASSCO
Norfolk segments, the pension enhancement benefit is frozen as of December 31, 2020. For Corporate
officers whose benefits have not already been frozen, the pension enhancement benefit is frozen as of
December 31, 2018, or the date they are named as an officer, if later.
Facility Closure
AMSEA
The AMSEA operation was shut down as of December 31, 2017.
Corporate Office Segment
Members classified as expatriate employees and members based in Fort Worth, Texas, dedicated to the
A-12 litigation who are covered under the Corporate Office segment continue to accrue plan
membership for final average pay formula benefits and pension enhancement benefits after December
31, 2013, including updates to Final Average Pay for service accrued from January 1, 2007 to December
31, 2013. Plan membership service and Final Average Pay for these expatriate employees and
members are frozen as of March 31, 2017.
Employee Transfers
Certain salaried employees who transfer between segments before January 1, 2005 remain subject to
the terms of the salaried benefit structure that the employee was covered by prior to the transfer for
benefit accruals prior to January 1, 2005. This summary of benefit provisions does not describe all such
benefit structures. The benefit provisions pertaining to each such benefit structure are described in the
summary of benefit provisions contained in the actuarial valuation report associated with such benefit
structure.

Benefit Provisions of OTS Garland Salaried Benefit Structure
Early Retirement Pension
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement payable as the greater of (i) and (ii) as follows:
i. The final average pay formula benefit based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2007, reduced 2-
1/2% for each year between age 62 and the date of commencement of benefits plus the final
average pay formula benefit based on service accrued after December 31, 2006, reduced 4.8% for
each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits.
ii. The split benefit formula benefit based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2004, reduced by 6-
2/3% for each year of the first five years prior to age 65 and 3-1/3% for each year prior to age 60
plus the split benefit formula based on service accrued from January 1, 2004 to December 31, 2006,
reduced by 2-1/2% for each year between age 62 and the date of commencement of benefits plus
the split benefit formula benefit based on service accrued after December 31, 2006, reduced by
4.8% for each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits.
Available Forms of Payment
Normal form of payment is a single life annuity. Optional forms of payment also available on an actuarial
equivalent basis are the 10 year certain and life annuity; and 50% and 100% contingent annuities. For
portion of benefit accrued based on 1-1/3% of final average pay, level income at 62 and 65 options are
also available on an actuarial equivalent basis.
Termination
If terminating employment after completion of five years of continuous service, the accrued normal
retirement pension is payable commencing at age 65. The benefit may commence prior to age 65 on an
actuarial equivalent basis if early retirement requirements are satisfied.
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse, the surviving spouse will be entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had
the member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 100% contingent annuitant option.
Death After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected; in any event, the excess, if any, of the death benefit payable
just prior to retirement over actual pension payments is paid to the beneficiary.
Employee Transfers
Certain salaried employees who transfer between segments before January 1, 2005 remain subject to
the terms of the salaried benefit structure that the employee was covered by prior to the transfer for
benefit accruals prior to January 1, 2005. This summary of benefit provisions does not describe all such
benefit structures. The benefit provisions pertaining to each such benefit structure are described in the
summary of benefit provisions contained in the actuarial valuation report associated with such benefit
structure.

General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Saco Salaried Benefit Structure
Benefit Structure Documents
General Dynamics Salaried Retirement Plan—Saco Legacy Provisions and General Dynamics Salaried
Retirement Plan.
Effective Date
January 1, 1999.
Eligibility
Salaried employees of General Dynamics Armament Systems-Saco Operations who have completed
one year of service. Salaried employees covered by a collective bargaining agreement may only be
covered if specifically provided in such agreement.
Closure to New Hires Date
January 1, 2007.
Normal Retirement Date
Age 65.
Early Retirement Date
Between ages 55 and 65, after completion of 10 years of continuous service. If member has service
prior to January 1, 2001, between ages 55 and 65, after completion of five years of continuous service.
Normal Retirement Pension
Final Average Pay Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2001: 1% of final average pay up to covered compensation, plus 1.45% of the
excess per year of credited service up to a maximum of 35 years; plus 1% of final average pay per
year of credited service in excess of 35 years. Benefit is reduced by the accrued benefit under
predecessor plan. Benefit is subject to a minimum of the benefit accrued through December 31,
2000.
ii. Service 1/1/2001 to 12/31/2006: 1-1/3% of final average pay per year of plan membership service.
iii. Service 1/1/2007 to 12/31/2013: 1% of final average pay per year of plan membership service.
iv. Service 1/1/2014 to 12/31/2017: $25 per year of plan membership service. Plan membership
service is frozen as of December 31, 2017.
Final average pay equals the average of the highest consecutive 60 monthly base rates of pay (including
100% of incentive compensation) received during last 120 months of plan membership. For service prior
to January 1, 2007, final average pay is frozen as of December 31, 2010. Final average pay for service
accrued from January 1, 2007 to December 31, 2013 is frozen as of December 31, 2013.
Covered compensation equals the average of the Social Security taxable wage bases in effect for each
calendar year during the 35 year period ending in the year prior to termination. Covered compensation is
frozen as of December 31, 2010.
14

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Saco Salaried Benefit Structure
Minimum Benefit Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2001: 1% of final average pay up to covered compensation, plus 1.45% of the
excess per year of credited service up to a maximum of 35 years; plus 1% of final average pay per
year of credited service in excess of 35 years. Benefit is reduced by the accrued benefit under
predecessor plan. Benefit is subject to a minimum of the benefit accrued through December 31,
2000.
ii. Service 1/1/2001 to 12/31/2006: $26.00 per year of plan membership service including that
additional period during which the member would have accrued benefits but for the service
requirement for eligibility to enter this benefit structure.
iii. Service after 12/31/2006: Same as Final Average Pay Formula.
Early Retirement Pension
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement based on service accrued prior to January 1, 2001,
reduced by 3.6% for each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits.
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement based on service accrued from January 1, 2001 to
December 31, 2006, reduced by 2-1/2% for each year between age 62 and the date of commencement
of benefits after completion of 10 years of continuous service, or reduced on an actuarial equivalent
basis before completion of 10 years of continuous service.
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement based on service accrued after December 31, 2006,
reduced by 4.8% for each year between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits after
completion of 10 years of continuous service, or reduced on an actuarial equivalent basis before
completion of 10 years of continuous service.
Available Forms of Payment
Normal form of payment is a single life annuity. Optional forms of payment also available on an actuarial
equivalent basis are the 10 year certain and life annuity; and 50% and 100% contingent annuities. For
portion of benefit accrued prior to January 1, 2007, level income at 62 and 65 options are also available
on an actuarial equivalent basis.
Termination
If terminating employment after completion of five years of continuous service, the accrued normal
retirement pension is payable commencing at age 65. The benefit may commence prior to age 65 with a
reduction of 3.6% for each year prior to age 65 applicable to the benefit based on service accrued prior
to January 1, 2001 and on an actuarial basis applicable to the benefit based on service accrued after
December 31, 2000, if early retirement requirements are satisfied.
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse, the surviving spouse will be entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had
the member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 100% contingent annuitant option.

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of ASDS Represented Benefit Structure
Termination
If terminating employment after completion of five years of service, the accrued normal retirement
pension is payable commencing at age 65. The benefit may commence between ages 60 and 65 equal
to the unreduced career average formula benefit plus the excess, if any, of the minimum benefit formula
benefit reduced by 6% for each year retirement precedes age 65 over the unreduced career average
formula benefit.
Members terminating with 20 years of service may commence benefits between ages 57 and 60 equal
to the career average formula benefit reduced 8% for each year retirement precedes age 60 plus the
excess, if any, of the minimum benefit formula benefit reduced by 6% for each year retirement precedes
age 65 over the career average formula benefit reduced 8% for each year retirement precedes age 60.
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse, the surviving spouse will be entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had
the member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 50% contingent annuitant option, reduced by 12% for
commencement before age 60. If death occurs after age 50 and after completion of 15 years of service,
the benefit will commence immediately reduced by 5% if commencement is between ages 55 and 60
and reduced by 10% if commencement is between ages 50 and 55.
Death After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected; in no event, is an amount less than the member's own
contributions with regular interest returned.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of AxleTech Salaried Sub-Plan Benefit Structure
Benefit Structure Document
AxleTech International, Inc. Retirement Plan – Sub-Plan #1 for Salaried and Certain Hourly Employees.
Effective Date
January 1, 2003.
Eligibility
Certain salaried employees and hourly employees not covered by a collective bargaining agreement of
AxleTech International, Inc. Salaried employees covered by a collective bargaining agreement may only
be covered if specifically provided in such agreement.
Closure to New Hires Date
June 24, 2009.
Normal Retirement Date
Age 65.
Early Retirement Date
Between ages 55 and 65. Includes those involuntarily separated with 10 years of continuous service who
reach age 55 within recall period.
Normal Retirement Pension
Standard Benefit Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2014: A monthly pension of 1.05% of final average annual earnings up to the
Social Security earnings limit, plus 1.50% of the excess per year of credited service up to a
maximum of 35 years. Benefit is subject to minimum benefit of predecessor plan accrued benefit as
of December 30, 2002. Benefit also reduced by Rockwell Plan accrued benefit as of September 30,
1997.
ii. Service after 12/31/2013: $25 per year of credited service.
Final average annual earnings equals the average of the highest 5 consecutive calendar years in the 10
calendar years preceding termination, retirement or death. For service accrued prior to January 1, 2014,
the final average annual earnings is frozen as of December 31, 2013.
Social Security earnings limit equals the lesser of (i) the average of the Social Security taxable wage
bases in effect for each calendar year during the 35 year period ending in the year in which the member
attains the Social Security retirement age, (ii) final average annual earnings, (iii) average annual earnings
over the three most recent consecutive calendar years preceding the year of termination, or (iv) the
average Social Security taxable wage bases in effect for the three years preceding the year of
termination. For service accrued prior to January 1, 2014, the Social Security earnings limit is frozen as
of December 31, 2013.
29

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of AxleTech Salaried Sub-Plan Benefit Structure
Grandfathered Meritor Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2014: The sum of (a) and (b), less the sum of (c) and (d):
a. 2-2/3% of final average annual earnings per year of credited service up to a maximum of 15
years.
b. 0.5% of final average annual earnings per year of credited service between 15 and 35 years.
c. Social Security limit percentage multiplied by the Social Security earnings limit per year of
credited service up to a maximum of 15 years.
d. 0.25% of the Social Security earnings limit per year of credited service between 15 and 35 years.
ii. Service after 12/31/2013: Same as Standard Benefit Formula.
Employees hired prior to January 1, 1993 by Rockwell, and who did not meet age and service
requirements on December 31, 2000 for the grandfathered group, have their benefit determined under
the Grandfathered Meritor formula with credited service frozen as of December 31, 2002.
The Social Security limit percentage based on date of birth is determined as shown below:
Date of Birth With Pre-1993 Service No Pre-1993 Service
Prior to 1/1/1938 0.445% 0.480%
1/1/1938 to 12/31/1954 0.425 0.455
After 12/31/1954 0.400 0.430
Early Retirement Pension
Standard Benefit Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the standard benefit formula, either (i) with no
reduction, if benefits commence at or after age 62 or (ii) reduced by 6% for each year between age 62
and the date of commencement of benefits, if benefits commence prior to age 62.
Grandfathered Meritor Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the Grandfathered Meritor formula attributable to
service accrued prior to January 1, 2003, either (i) with no reduction, if the member has years of age plus
credited service equal to 85 or more or (ii) reduced by 6% for each year between age 60 and the date of
commencement of benefits, plus the balance of the accrued benefit attributable to service after
December 31, 2002, reduced by 6% for each year between age 62 and the date of commencement of
benefits.
In addition, for members eligible for benefits under the Grandfathered Meritor formula a supplement is
payable between early retirement date and age 62, or earlier death, if benefits commence prior to age
62. If the member has years of age plus credited service equal to 85 or more, the supplement is equal to
normal retirement benefits (c) and (d), above, prorated for years of credited service. For members of the
grandfathered group who retire on or after age 55 and who have not commenced payment of their
Rockwell benefit, or who retire after attaining age 60 with 15 years of credited service, the supplement is
equal to $3,900 per year, if greater.
30

Benefit Provisions of AxleTech Salaried Sub-Plan Benefit Structure
Available Forms of Payment
Normal form of payment is a single life annuity. Optional forms of payment also available are 60%, 75%
and 100% contingent annuities on a subsidized basis and 10 year certain and life annuity on an actuarial
equivalent basis. 50%, 75% and 100% contingent annuities also available on an actuarial equivalent
basis with a non-spouse contingent annuitant.
Termination
If terminating employment after completion of five years of continuous service, the accrued normal
retirement pension is payable commencing at age 65. The benefit may commence prior to age 65, if
early retirement requirements are satisfied, reduced for early commencement as follows:
Age When Benefit Early Retirement Age When Benefit Early Retirement
Commences Factor Commences Factor
55 57.9% 59 80.8%
56 63.5 60 86.7
57 69.4 61 93.3
58 75.2 62 & Over 100.0
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse, the surviving spouse will be entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had
the member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 60% contingent annuitant option. For an active
member who dies after attaining age 55 or with 10 years of continuous service, but prior to commencing
his Rockwell benefit, the surviving spouse will be entitled to a benefit payable equal to 25% of final
average annual earnings, reduced by 1.5% for each year the surviving spouse is more than five years
younger than the member, if greater. Alternatively, for an active member who dies prior to age 55 and
with less than 10 years of continuous service, but prior to commencing his Rockwell benefit, the
surviving spouse may elect a lump sum payment equal to the greater of either (i) the member's final
annual rate of pay or (ii) the present value of the benefits payable to the surviving spouse had the
member terminated employment on the date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the
earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 60% contingent annuitant option.
If a member dies prior to eligibility for a vested benefit or without a surviving spouse, his beneficiary will
be entitled to receive a lump sum payment equal to the member's final annual rate of pay.
The final average annual earnings used to determine the surviving spouse benefits above is frozen as of
December 31, 2013.
Death After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected. For active members who retired a lump sum is payable equal
to 25% of final average annual earnings but not less than $2,500 nor more than $10,000. In any event,
the excess, if any, of the member's final annual rate of pay over actual benefits paid to the surviving
spouse is payable upon death of the surviving spouse.
The final average annual earnings used to determine the lump sum death benefit is frozen as of
December 31, 2013.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Basic EPP
Effective Date
February 1, 1967.
Covered Employees
Employees of the Company or a designated affiliate who are not covered by a collective bargaining
agreement; also all TMD salaried employees effective November 2, 1991. Effective in 2005, RTSC
employees became eligible to join the Plan.
Effective August 6, 2006, employees previously covered by the CSC Raytheon E-Systems Retirement
Plan became participants in this plan (but the benefits provided were the same as provided under the "E-
Systems" Plan) as that plan was merged into the CSC Employee Pension Plan (EPP) on that date.
Then, effective September 23, 2006, these employees became eligible to participate in the standard
provisions of the EPP for future service after that date (with all benefits accrued before that date covered
by provisions of the prior E-Systems Retirement Plan, which are now part of the EPP).
Effective September 23, 2006, employees who were previously covered by the CSC Hughes Retirement
Plan and non-"AT&T" employees previously covered by the CSC Cash Balance Plan became eligible to
participate in the EPP (all benefits accrued under those plans remain in those prior plans). Similarly,
effective December 16, 2006, employees previously covered by the CSC Pension Equity Plan became
eligible to participate (while prior accrued benefits remain in that prior plan). Effective April 7, 2007, the
remaining employees ("AT&T" employees) in the CSC Cash Balance Plan became eligible to participate
in the EPP (all prior benefits for those employees remain in the prior plan). Effective December 22, 2008
the prior frozen benefits (and corresponding plan provisions) from these plans were merged into the
EPP.
Effective November 27, 2015, CSC completed the separation of its wholly owned subsidiary, Computer
Sciences Government Holdings, Inc. ("CSRA"). As part of this separation, sponsorship of the Employee
Pension Plan was transferred from CSC to CSRA. Employees who did not transfer with the Plan were
deemed terminated for purposes of the Plan.
Accrual Freeze
Effective July 10, 2009, future benefit accruals were frozen for all participants except Conoco, DuPont
and Logmod employees. For all participants whose benefits were frozen there are no future employee
contributions after July 9, 2010 (January 4, 2013 for Conoco and Logmod participants, August 14, 2015
for DuPont participants). There will be no new entrants to the plan after May 20, 2009. Effective
January 5, 2013, future benefit accruals were frozen for all Conoco and Logmod participants. Effective
August 14, 2015, future benefit accruals were frozen for all DuPont participants.
Participation Date
Prior to August 5, 1988, first of any pay period after hire provided the covered employee agrees to make
the required contributions. If an employee was not a participant on August 5, 1988, then such employee
must either be age 21 and have completed one year of service, or be at least age 40, whichever is
earlier, to be eligible to enter the plan. There will be no new entrants to the plan after May 20, 2009.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Basic EPP
Definitions
Pension Service
Elapsed time during which the employee made the required contributions to the CSC Employee Pension
Plan.
Vesting Service
Same as pension service except the period for eligibility (elapsed time for regular employees; 1000
hours for part time and seasonal workers) and periods of participation in the INFONET and CSR Plans
will also count. Service with General Dynamics' counts for TMD employees. Also, all periods where an
employee was covered by another CSC pension plan will count (as long as any required employee
contributions were made).
Pensionable Earnings
Base pay, but not exceeding $200,000 (indexed from 1989 forward ($235,840 in 1993), then decreasing
to $150,000 for 1994 and indexed from that point forward but rounded down to the next lowest $10,000,
or as provided for by Section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue Code, as subsequently amended.
Normal Retirement Date (NRD)
First of month coinciding with or next following attainment of age 65.
Basic Annual Pension Benefit
As of any date, the larger of (i) and (ii), plus (iii), (iv) and (v) below, payable as a life annuity from Normal
Retirement Date:
i. 2% of average pensionable earnings for the last five plan years ended December 31, 1986,
multiplied by the employee's pension service through December 31, 1986.
ii. The previous accrued benefit as of December 31, 1986 based on the prior plan.
iii. 2.25% of pensionable earnings for each plan year of participation after December 31, 1986 but not
beyond July 9, 2009 for participants whose benefit was frozen as of that date.
iv. For certain participant, amounts listed in Appendix M and Appendix N of the Plan.
v. For certain participants (GD, DuPont, Conoco, various Raytheon groups, E-Systems), there may be
prior frozen or ongoing benefits which may be payable in addition to or in conjunction with the above,
(i) through (iv)—see the separate subsections of this Summary for details of differences in
provisions relating to those groups.
vi. Effective December 22, 2008 frozen benefits (and corresponding plan provisions) from the CSC
Hughes Retirmeent Plan, the CSC Pension Equity Plan and the CSC Cash Balance were merged
into the CSC Employee Pension Plan. Refer to the separate subsections of this Summary for details
relating to those benefits and related plan provisions.

Terminate for reasons other than death or retirement after completing 5 years of vesting service. All

Death while employed and while otherwise eligible for deferred vested, early, normal or postponed
retirement benefits with a surviving spouse.

Effective Date
Originally October 1, 1956. Effective as frozen benefits in CSC Employee Pension Plan on November 2,

Eligibility
Salaried participants in the General Dynamics Plan on November 2, 1991 (including transfers and

Age 65
Early Retirement Dates
Between ages 55 and 65. Benefits payable under final average pay formula also require completion of

Final Average Pay

Career Average Pay Formula

annual earnings rate as of December 31, 1963 per year of service from October 1, 1956 to
December 1, 1963.

iii. Service 1/1/1964 to 12/31/1965: 0.7% of the first $4,800, plus 2% of the excess over $4,800, of
1964 and 1965 annual earnings.
iv. Service 1/1/1966 to 12/31/1969: 1.1% of the first $6,600, plus 2% of the excess over $6,600, of
annual earnings per year of service from January 1, 1966 to December 31, 1969.

$312 multiplied by the period, in years and months, during which benefits were accrued under the

but for the age and/or service requirements for eligibility to enter the General Dynamics Plan, plus 150%

Alternate Benefit Formula
If the member's 50th birthday was before January 1, 1976, the minimum pension is 3% of base earnings
after the later of age 50, October 1, 1956, and membership in the Plan, and prior to age 65, less 75% of
the Primary Insurance Amount payable under the Social Security Act. If the member's 50th birthday is on
or after January 1, 1976, the minimum pension equals (i) multiplied by (ii), less (iii):
i. The total base earnings from the 48th birthday, the date of membership in the Plan or January 1,
1976, whichever is latest;
ii. Divided by the number of years between the date in (i) and the normal retirement date, but not
greater than 3%;
iii. Of the Primary Insurance Amount payable under the Social Security Act.

years 1980 to 1984 (including 50% of incentive compensation).

Benefit Provisions (Frozen) of General Dynamics Retirement Plan

Early Retirement Pension
Final Average Pay Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the final average pay formula (or under the
minimum benefit formula, if greater), either (1) with no reduction, if benefits commence at or after age
62, or (ii) reduced by 2-1/2% for each year between age 62 and the date of commencement of benefits,
if benefits commence prior to age 62.
Career Average Pay Formula
The benefit accrued to date of early retirement under the career average pay formula (or under the
minimum benefit formula, if greater), with no reduction if the sum of a member's age and service
("points") equals or exceeds the required number of points at each age as specified below:
Attained Age Required Attained Age Required
55 85 60 80
56 84 61 76
57 83 62 72
58 82 63 68
59 81 64 69
Service continues to accrue for purposes of determining points for as long as the TMD employees
remain with CSC.
If these point requirements are not met, the accrued benefit will be payable either commencing at
normal retirement date, or if commencing immediately, reduced by the lesser of (i) 2-1/2% times the
number of points by which age plus service are less than those required, or (ii) 2-1/2% for each year
between age 65 and the date of commencement of benefits.
In addition, if the early retirement benefit is payable under the career average pay formula and
commences prior to age 62, a temporary annual supplemental benefit is payable between early
retirement date and age 62, or earlier death, equal to $18 per year of service as a member between
October 1, 1956 and the date of retirement. No additional supplemental benefit accrued after July 1,
1990. This temporary benefit is reduced by the same factor as for the accrued benefit above, if
applicable.
Alternate Benefit Formula
The benefit accrued under the alternate benefit formula, multiplied by the appropriate percentage from
the following table:
Age When Benefit Early Retirement Age When Benefit Early Retirement
Commences Percentage Commences Percentage
55 54.0% 60 74.0%

57 62.0 62 88.0

General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions (Frozen) of General Dynamics Retirement Plan
(Government) For Salaried Employees
Employee Contributions
No employee contributions were required subsequent to January 1, 1982.
Termination
Full vesting of the accrued benefit after five years of service, which is payable, on an actuarially
equivalent basis, commencing at any time between age 55 and the normal retirement date; in no event
is an amount less than the member's own contributions with regular interest returned. Years of service
with CSC count towards this vesting.
Death Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit and leaves a
surviving spouse to whom he/she has been married for at least one year, the surviving spouse will be
entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had the member terminated employment on the
date of death with payment of benefits to commence on the earliest date permitted thereafter and
elected the 50% contingent annuitant option.
Death After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected (all forms of benefits allowed under the General Dynamics Plan
are available with respect to the frozen benefits, payable under the same terms as for the predecessor
plan). In any event, the excess, if any, of the death benefit payable just prior to retirement over actual
pension payments is paid to the beneficiary.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of DuPont Employees
(These special provisions are frozen for DuPont Pharma participants effective September 22, 2006 and
for all other DuPont participants effective August 14, 2015.)¹
All employees transferred from DuPont as of June 1, 1997 (and up to 24 months thereafter) will be able
to participate in the CSC Employee Pension Plan for future service once the eligibility requirements are
met (DuPont service counts to satisfy such eligibility requirements). The CSC Plan provides for a benefit
of 2.25% of each year's earnings after May 31, 1997.
The CSC Plan is modified for DuPont employees in several areas:
i. All prior benefits, contributions, etc. relating to service prior to June 1, 1997 were transferred to the
CSC Plan. Such frozen prior DuPont benefits will increase with future salary increases but will not
increase with service. All such benefits earned prior to June 1, 1997 will be based on the provisions
of the DuPont plan as of that date.
ii. DuPont early retirement and optional form provisions will be incorporated into the plan for DuPont
employees, for both the prior DuPont benefit and for the CSC portion. DuPont death and disability
benefits are also preserved. The early retirement provisions incorporated include both the eligibility
requirements and the factors.
iii. The benefits to be received by adding the frozen DuPont benefit (adjusted for future salary
increases) to the CSC benefit will never be less than the benefit the employee would have received
had he or she been covered by the DuPont benefit provisions for all years of service (minimum
benefit).
Participation in the CSC plan for future service is contingent upon the employee contributing 3% of base
earnings to the Plan.
Earnings used for the CSC benefit are base pay plus sales incentive plan compensation (including
section 401(k) and Section 125 deferrals). In both the DuPont frozen and minimum benefit calculations,
the DuPont definition of earnings will apply.
Vesting occurs after five years of service including service with DuPont.
If a DuPont participant retired from DuPont prior to joining CSC on June 1, 1997, special provisions
apply. Such employees' benefits will be calculated under DuPont's early retirement provisions
considering all service. Also the DuPont benefit options will be limited since certain of the DuPont
postretirement death benefit provisions will have already been paid from the DuPont Plan and are not to
be duplicated in this Plan.
Following is a brief summary of provisions, which relate to eligibility for and benefits paid at normal
retirement, early retirement, incapacity, termination with vesting, and death relating to the DuPont
benefits referred to above.
¹ All benefits earned on and after September 23, 2006 for this group are per the terms of the basic EPP.

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of DuPont Employees
Normal and Early Retirement Eligibility and Reductions
An employee will be eligible for retirement with full pension: (1) when he reaches age 65 and has at least
15 years of service, or (2) if he voluntarily retires after he reaches age 58 and his age plus service is at
least 85, or (3) if he becomes permanently incapable of performing the duties of his position with the
degree of efficiency required by the Company and has at least 15 years of service. An employee not
eligible for retirement with full pension will be eligible for retirement with reduced pension (1) if he
voluntarily retires between the ages of 50 and 64 inclusive and has at least 15 years of service, or (2) if
he elects optional retirement when he would otherwise be involuntarily terminated for any reason other
than discharge for cause, provided he is at least age 50 with at least 15 years of service, or (3) if he
elects optional retirement when he would otherwise be involuntarily terminated specifically for lack of
work, provided he is at least age 45 with at least 25 years of service.
The early retirement reduction for voluntary retirement is 5% per year for each year of age plus service
less than 85, where service used to calculate the reduction factor is not less than 20 years and not
greater than 27 years, provided the reduction is no more than 50%. For optional retirement, the normal
retirement pension will be reduced by five-twelfths of 1% for each month by which the month of
retirement proceeds the earliest month that participant, with continuous employment, is eligible for an
unreduced normal retirement pension.
The amount of an employee's DuPont monthly pension used above will be the greater of:
i. The number of his years of service multiplied by 1.2% of his average monthly pay during his highest
paid three years,
ii. The number of his years of service multiplied by 1.5% of his average monthly pay during his highest
paid three years less 50% of Primary Social Security Benefit, or
iii. $9 for each year of service plus 10% of his average monthly pay during his highest paid three years.
The amount of monthly pension under a or b above is limited to an amount which, when added to the
employee's full Primary Social Security Benefit, will equal 100% of such average monthly pay. Pay
includes total pay from the employer, but excludes transfer employment allowance, award and payments
under a gain sharing program, the Special Compensation Plan, the Stock Option Plan and the former
Dividend Unit Plan or similar plans of DuPont or any of its affiliated companies. Earnings for calculating
average monthly pay have been limited by IRC Section 401(a) (17) and benefits are further limited by
the amount permitted under IRC Section 415.
Incapacity Retirement
An employee retired because of incapability will receive a supplemental payment of the greater of 50%
of Primary Social Security Benefit and $90 monthly until he is eligible for old age benefits or receives
disability payments under the applicable Federal Social Security Act.

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of DuPont Employees
Termination With Vesting
An employee who is terminated for any reason with at least five years of service and who is not eligible
for any other benefit under the Plan will have a vested right to a deferred pension payable at age 65, or
at age 60 if he has at least 30 years of service (if 30 years of service, a reduced pension is available
below age 60). If the terminated employee has 15 through 29 years of service, he may elect to receive
payments on a reduced basis starting at age 50, or at age 60 if the terminated employee has 10 through
14 years of service. The amount of vested pension will be calculated by the greater of the formulas in (i),
(ii), and (iii) under the Normal Retirement provisions above, except that in applying formula (iii), 2/3% of
average monthly pay multiplied by service shall be substituted for 10% of average monthly pay where
service is less than 15 years. At time of application, a former employee's vested pension will be
actuarially reduced to provide his spouse with monthly payments equal to 50% of his actuarially reduced
pension, unless the employee validly elects otherwise.
An employee hired after age 60 who is terminated at age 65 or older, with five or more years of service,
will immediately begin to receive a pension calculated in the same manner as a deferred pension
described in the preceding paragraph.
Death Benefits
Survivor benefits equal to 0.5% of the deceased employee's average monthly pay during his highest
paid three years multiplied by the number of years of service (but not less than $4 per year of service
plus 4% of such average monthly pay) are payable to the employee's specified survivor (limited to
spouse, minor children, or parents) upon the death of an employee who had retired with pension or of an
active employee who dies after attaining 15 years of service, regardless of age. After death of an active
employee with at least five, but less than 15 years of service, a death benefit is payable to the surviving
spouse equal to 50% of the participant's deferred vested pension (reduced for early retirement, pre-
retirement spouse coverage and postretirement joint and survivor coverage) commencing at the later of
the participant's earliest benefit commencement age or the month following the death of the participant.
The spouse benefit option provides an additional monthly payment to the spouse of between 10% and
20% of the employee's calculated pension (or the pension that would have been payable had the
employee retired immediately prior to death) after reduction for pre-retirement coverage. Pre-retirement
coverage begins after reaching age 55 with at least 15 years of service. Pre-retirement and post-
retirement coverage is automatic at retirement, unless an employee validly elects otherwise.
For the joint and survivor option, an employee retiring after age 50 with at least 25 years of service, or
eligible for an unreduced pension under the age or voluntary retirement provisions, may elect at least
three months prior to retirement to provide a regular monthly income after his death following retirement
to a survivor of his choice by having his pension actuarially reduced. Payments to the survivor may be in
increments of 10% of his pension prior to actuarial reduction for this coverage, provided that the amount
paid to any person so named, plus any amount payable under the survivor benefit or spouse benefit
option above may not exceed the employee's actuarially reduced pension. The minimum monthly benefit
under this provision is $25 if the specified survivor is not the specified survivor in the survivor benefit
provision above.

(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Conoco Employees
Normal Retirement
Condition for Retirement: Any member in service who attains his normal retirement date (age 65) may
retire on a normal retirement allowance.
Amount of Conoco Allowance: The annual Conoco normal retirement allowance used above is equal to
the following:
i. 1.6% of the member's three-year average compensation for each year of creditable service, less
1.5% of his primary Social Security benefit multiplied by his years of creditable service; but such
offset is not to exceed 50% of the member's primary Social Security benefit, or
ii. For members who joined the former Conoco Plan prior to January 1, 1971, an alternative allowance
equal to 1% of the part of the member's ten-year average compensation not in excess of $3,000
plus 1.5% of the part of such compensation in excess of $3,000, multiplied by the number of years
of creditable service, or
iii. A minimum allowance equal to $144 multiplied by the number of years of creditable service.
Early Retirement
Condition for Retirement: Any member in service who has not reached his normal retirement date (age
65) but who has attained age 50 and has completed 10 years of service may retire on an early
retirement allowance.
Amount of Allowance: The early retirement allowance is equal to a retirement allowance commencing
immediately which is computed as a normal retirement allowance on the basis of the member's
creditable service at the time of early retirement, multiplied by the factors in the following Schedule I;
provided, however, that where the alternative allowance or the minimum allowance is applicable that part
of the allowance based on creditable service prior to January 1, 1971 is reduced in accordance with
Schedule II, and that part of the allowance based on creditable service subsequent to January 1, 1971 is
reduced in accordance with Schedule I.

Incapacity Retirement
Condition for Retirement: Any member in service who has not reached his normal retirement date but
who has attained age 40 and has completed 10 years of service may be retired on an incapacity
retirement allowance provided that such member is eligible to receive Social Security Disability benefits.
Amount of Allowance: The incapacity retirement allowance commences immediately and is computed
as a normal retirement allowance on the basis of the member's average compensation and creditable

Termination With Vesting (Separation Retirement)
Condition for Retirement: A member who has completed 5 years of service and whose services with the
Company are terminated is eligible to receive a separation retirement allowance.
Amount of Allowance: The separation retirement allowance is deferred retirement allowance
commencing at normal retirement date, equal to the member's normal retirement allowance based on
the member's average compensation and creditable service at the time of separation from the
Company.
Death Benefits
Condition for Allowance: In the event that a member who is married prior to the date of his death and
who has not reached his normal retirement date but who has completed 5 years of service and dies in
active service, his surviving spouse is eligible for a surviving spouse allowance.
Amount of Allowance: The surviving spouse allowance commences at death or age 50, whichever is
later, and is equal to an early retirement allowance additionally reduced to reflect a joint and 50%
survivor annuity.
For an employee who has completed 15 years of service and dies in active service, the surviving spouse
allowance commences immediately and is reduced to reflect a joint and 50% survivor annuity.

Benefit Provisions of Conoco Employees
Form of Allowance Payments
Normal Form: The normal form of allowance payments for a member who does not have a spouse at
the date the allowance payments commence is lifetime payments. For a member who has a spouse on
the date the allowance payments commence, the normal form of allowance payments, which are in a
reduced amount of equivalent actuarial value to those he would receive if he did not have a spouse, are
lifetime payments with 50% of his reduced allowance continued after his death for the remainder of the
life of his spouse.
Optional Forms: A member may elect to convert his normal form of allowance into an allowance of
equivalent actuarial value in accordance with certain options permitted under Title 2 of the Plan. In
particular, pensioners may elect to receive payments in the form of a Joint and 100% Survivor annuity or
a lump sum payment.

(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Raytheon TI Employees
Credited Service for Benefit Accrual
The number of years and completed days of a participant's service after his last date of employment and
prior to the earlier of January 1, 1976, his normal retirement date, or date of termination. This includes
any period of leave of absence during this time unless the participant was employed with a
nonparticipating subsidiary.
The number of years and completed days of a participant's service on and after January 1, 1976 during
which he participated in the plan (or would have participated in the plan if there had been no age
requirement). This includes any period of leave of absence and for an employee on December 31, 1975
who became a participant on or before January 1, 1997, his service during 1976 prior to participation.
Credited service for benefit accrual excludes all years of service prior to a break-in-credited-service
occurring after December 1, 1975 and before January 1, 1985 of an participant who has not satisfied the
requirements for a vested right to a deferred benefit and whose number of consecutive breaks in
credited service equal or exceed the aggregate number of his years of credited service prior to the break
in credited service. After January 1, 1985, five consecutive one-year breaks must occur before any
service is excluded as described above.
Credited Service for Vesting
The number of years of credited service completed by a participant, excluding:
i. All years of credited service prior to a termination of employment which occurred before January 1,
1976 except full calendar years of service for a participant who was rehired within two years after
such termination of employment.
ii. All years of credited service prior to a break-in credited-service until the participant has completed a
year of credited service after the break-in-credited service; and
iii. All years of credited service prior to a break-in credited-service of any participant who has not
satisfied the requirements for a vested right to deferred benefits and whose number of consecutive
breaks-in-credited-service. After January 1, 1985, five consecutive one-year breaks must occur
before any service is excluded as described above.
Average Credited Earnings
The annual average of the participant's compensation for the highest five consecutive calendar years of
credited service for benefit accrual, but considering no earnings after September 22, 2006.
Final Average Earnings
The lower of (i) the average of participant's compensation, up to Social Security Wage Base, for the 3-
year period ending with the year preceding retirement or termination, and (ii) the average of the Social
Security Wage Base for the 35-year period ending with the year the participant reaches Social Security
Retirement Age. In no case will earnings after September 22, 2006 be considered.

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Raytheon TI Employees
Deferred Vested Benefit
Upon termination of employment after a participant has completed five years of credited service for
vesting, the participants is entitled to an annuity deferred to age 65. The benefit is determined as for
early retirement.
If the participant terminates prior to age 60, then the participant may elect to receive a reduced benefit
commencing on the first day of any month prior to his normal retirement date beginning with the second
month following his attainment of age 60. This reduced benefit shall be actuarially determined.
Disability Benefit
A participant is eligible for a benefit if he becomes totally and permanently disabled prior to age 65 and
after five years of credited service for vesting. The annuity, deferred to age 65, is computed as for
normal retirement, considering compensation to date of disablement and credited service for benefit
accrual (including the number of years and days between the date of disablement and the normal
retirement date) to normal retirement date.
Death Benefit
The designated beneficiary of a participant who dies in-service and beyond normal retirement shall
receive a benefit equal to 50% of the normal retirement benefit the participant would have received had
he retired on the date of his death.
Survivor Benefit
Upon the death of an active participant who has met the requirements for a deferred vested benefit, the
designated beneficiary is eligible to receive a benefit for life (or the equivalent lump sum) equal to 50%
of the benefit the employee could have received if he had terminated employment on the date of his
death and elected a joint and survivor option with payments commencing at the earliest date
permissible.
Normal Form of Retirement Benefit
For a married participant, a reduced 50% joint and survivor annuity under which the participant shall
receive a reduced amount of retirement benefit for life, and after the participant's death his spouse, if
such spouse was married to the participant on the participant's retirement date and if such spouse
survives the participant, shall receive for life 50% of the retirement benefit payable while they were both
alive.
For an unmarried participant, an income payable for life. Payments will commence on the first day of
the second month following the participant's retirement date, except that if the participant retires on the
first day of the month, payments will commence on the first day of the following month. The last
payment will be made on the first day of the month following the month in which the participant's death
occurs, and will be prorated to reflect the number of days in the month that the participant was alive.
Optional Forms of Retirement Benefit
Lump sum, joint and survivor, five years certain and life, ten years certain and life, life only, and any
other option designated by the applicable Retirement Committee are available.

All prior Plan benefits accrued under the “DynCorp Salaried” Plan were frozen upon merger into the CSC
Employee Pension Plan effective May 22, 2004.
Effective Date
December 11, 1999.
Employees Eligible to Participate
All regular salaried employees of DynCorp or any affiliate that co-sponsored the plan.
Definitions
Compensation
Basic remuneration and incentive bonuses including commissions and bonuses for sales, but excluding
overtime, differentials, and premiums.
Average Monthly Compensation
One twelfth of the highest average of any five consecutive years of compensation during employment.
Vesting Service
i. Prior to January 1,1976: Accredited Service under the Plan, similarly determined service under any
other plan and customary employment (usually 2,080) for periods not covered by any plan.
ii. On or after January 1, 1976: One year for each calendar year which includes 1,000 Hours of
Service with fractional service based on customary employment hours (usually 2,080) for calendar
years that include less than 1,000 Hours of Service but more than 500 Hours or Service.
Accredited Service
Active employment with the Company or any Affiliate. Accredited Service is determined on a calendar
year basis with fractional credit based on Hours of Service and customary hours worked.
For former Contel employees, Accredited Service includes the period of "credited service" recognized
under the Contel Pension Plan, if any, prior to the date of transfer to coverage under this plan.
Social Security Integration Level
The average annual earnings with respect to which Primary Social Security benefits would be payable
assuming that earnings were equal to the maximum taxable wage base each year prior to termination of
employment and the employee were age 65 on the date employment terminates.

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions of Raytheon E-Systems, CTAS and Raython (Hughes)
Employees
All employees described below will be able to participate in the CSC Employee Pension Plan (EPP)
standard provisions for future service (as defined below) once the eligibility requirements are met
(Raytheon service counts toward such requirements)—these provisions provide for a benefit of 2.25% of
each year’s earnings after the applicable date below. For service prior to the dates below, applicable
provisions of this section apply:
i. Former E-Systems and CTAS employees who were covered by the former Raytheon E-Systems
Pension Plan were transferred to a “mirror” plan, the CSC/E-Systems Pension Plan on January 29,
2000. This mirror plan and its provisions was merged into the EPP on August 6, 2006. Then on
September 22, 2006, all benefits and provisions of the prior E-Systems/CTAS plans were frozen.
The applicable benefits described below relate to all benefits earned before January 29, 2000 and
after that date up through September 22, 2006 when such benefits were frozen and these
employees were then covered by the EPP for future service on and after September 23, 2006.
ii. Raytheon (Hughes) employees who were covered by the former Raytheon Non-bargaining
Retirement Plan were transferred to a “mirror” plan, the CSC/Raytheon Retirement Plan on
January 29, 2000. In 2003 the mirror plan (and all related provisions) was merged with the CSC/E-
Systems Pension Plan. On August 6, 2006, the CSC/E-Systems Pension Plan(including the prior
provisions of the CSC/Raytheon Retirement Plan was merged into the EPP and then on September
22, 2006 all benefits (including the prior CSC/Raytheon Retirement Plan provisions) were frozen.
The applicable benefits described below relate to all benefits earned under the described
predecessor plans through September 22, 2006 and these employees were then covered by the
EPP for future service on and after September 23, 2006.
The EPP is modified for these Raytheon employees for benefits earned prior to September 23, 2006 in
several areas:
i. All prior benefits, contributions, etc. relating to service prior to January 29, 2000 were transferred to
the applicable CSC Plan. Such prior Raytheon benefits increased with future salary increases
through September 22, 2006, and with service but only through September 22, 2006. All benefits
earned prior to January 29, 2000 will be based on the provisions of the applicable Raytheon plan as
of that date. Benefits earned for service between January 29, 2000 and September 22, 2006 will be
based on the provisions of the applicable CSC plan as of September 22, 2006.
ii. All Raytheon Pension Plan and Raytheon E-Systems Pension Plan early retirement optional form,
and other provisions were incorporated into the applicable CSC plan covering such applicable
employees, for both the prior Raytheon benefit and for the applicable CSC portion for benefits
earned through September 22, 2006. Raytheon death and disability benefits relative to benefits
earned through September 22, 2006 are also preserved. The early retirement provisions
incorporated include both the eligibility requirements and the factors.
Participation in the EPP for future service after September 22, 2006 is contingent upon the employee
contributing 3% of base earnings to the Plan.

ii. Former CTAS Employees

2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions (Frozen) of CSC/Hughes Retirement Plan Participants
The following summary describes principal plan provisions relating to frozen CSC/Hughes Retirement
Plan participants and the benefits accrued prior to September 22, 2006:
General Information
Original Effective Date: January 1, 1960
Effective Date of Last Amendment: December 22, 2008
Plan Year: January 1st to December 31st
Eligibility
All employees of the Employer are eligible to participate in the Plan as of the January 1 or July 1 next
following the completion of one qualifying year of service. Employees who were previously excluded due
to being 60 years of age or older at the time of employment may now par ticipate in the Plan, but no
earlier than January 1, 1988. Effective September 22, 2006, the Plan was frozen for all future
participation and benefit accruals. Effective December 22, 2008, the benefits related to Hughes plan
participants were merged into the EPP.
Service
Service shall equal total years of service with the Employer. A year of service is credited for each plan
year in which an employee works 1,000 Hours or for each plan year during which the participant is
receiving Disability Benefits.
A break in service occurs at the start of any plan year in which the employee works 500 Hours or less for
the Employer in such year. Service will not be interrupted by:
i. A leave of absence granted by the Employer.
ii. A period of service in the Armed Forces of the United States under which employment rights are
granted.
iii. Transfer of employment from one participating Employer to another.
iv. Maternity/paternity leave.
An employee will be given credit for his pre-break service if either of the following occurs:
i. The employee had a vested interest in his accrued benefit at the time of his break in service, or
ii. The employee's period of absence was less than the greater of his pre-break service or 5 years.
Credited Service shall mean years and completed months of service prior to January 1, 1976 and full
years of service afterward. Effective after September 22, 2006, there are no future benefit accruals
under this Plan; however, participants became eligible at that time to participate in the Computer
Sciences Corporation Employee Pension Plan.
Service prior to an effective date, as applicable, shall be disregarded as provided in an Employing
Company's adoption agreement.
77

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions (Frozen) of CSC/Hughes Retirement Plan Participants
Normal Retirement Date
Normal Retirement Date is the later of the last day of the month of attainment of age 65 or the earlier of
the 5th anniversary of participation and 5 Years of Service.
Normal Retirement Benefit
The amount of annual benefit based on service to Normal Retirement Date is:
i. 0.155% of one percent of Average Compensation multiplied by years of Credited Service, less
ii. 1.25% of primary Social Security Benefits in effect at the time of actual retirement multiplied by years
of Credited Service.
The maximum annual benefit payable from the Plan shall be based on the Social Security Normal
Retirement age maximum.
Delayed Retirement
A participant may continue in the employment of the Employer after his Normal Retirement Date. In such
event he will receive at actual retirement the greater of the actuarial equivalent of his Normal Retirement
Benefit or the benefit based on service and compensation as of actual Retirement Date.
Average Compensation
The average of the highest five consecutive plan years of basic compensation paid during the 15 years
preceding actual Retirement Date. Compensation for each year shall not exceed the IRC Section
401(a)(17) limit and compensation after September 22, 2006 will not be considered.
Accrued Benefit
The Accrued Benefit at any time prior to a participant's Normal Retirement Date shall be the Normal
Retirement Benefit calculated using average compensation and Credited Service as of the plan freeze
date, September 22, 2006.
Early Retirement Benefit
Upon the completion of 10 years of Credited Service and the attainment of age 55, a participant may
elect to retire. He may receive an immediate benefit equal to the Normal Retirement Benefit based on
service at early retirement and appropriately reduced for early retirement.
Disability Retirement Benefit
Effective April 18, 1990, a participant who becomes totally and permanently disabled before his Normal
Retirement Date will receive a benefit at age 65 based on Credited Service at age 65 and Average
Compensation at date of disability. Prior to April 18, 1990, the Disability Benefit is as described under the
prior Plan.

General Dynamics Corporation
(EIN: 13-1673581, PN: 001)
General Dynamics Retirement Plan (Government)
2024 Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions
Benefit Provisions (Frozen) of CSC/Hughes Retirement Plan Participants
Death Benefit
In the event of an active married participant's death on or before the earliest retirement age, the
surviving spouse shall receive a benefit based on the participant's vested Accrued Benefit as of the date
of death, but payable as if the participant had separated from service on the date of death, survived to
the earliest retirement age, elected a Joint and 50% Survivor Annuity, and died on the day after the
earliest retirement age.
In the event of an active married participant's death after the attainment of age 55 and the completion of
10 years of Credited Service, but prior to Normal Retirement Date, it will be assumed the participant had
retired on the day prior to death and elected a Joint and 50% Survivor Benefit.
Severance Benefit
Upon the termination of employment after 5 or more Years of Service a participant shall have a vested
interest in his Accrued Benefit which will be payable at Normal Retirement Date. The percentage vested
shall be:
Years of Service Vested Percent
Fewer than 5 0%
5 or more 100
In the event that a participant has met the service requirements for Early Retirement at the date of
termination, he may elect to receive his vested interest at age 55. Such benefit will be reduced as
described under Early Retirement Benefit.
Normal Form of Payment
The Normal Form of Payment is an annuity paid in monthly installments for life.
Optional Methods of Settlement
All Optional Methods of Settlement are actuarially equivalent to the Normal Form of Payment. If a
married participant does not elect the Normal Form of Payment or does not elect one of the Optional
Methods of Settlement described below, then the participant's Retirement Benefit shall automatically be
paid under option (i) below. The options are:
i. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant's lifetime with one-half of the reduced benefit to
be continued to his spouse for her lifetime after his death.
ii. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant's lifetime with 2/3rd or 3/4th of the reduced
benefit to be continued to his spouse for her lifetime after his death.
iii. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant's lifetime with the same reduced benefit to be
continued to his spouse for her lifetime after his death.
iv. A reduced benefit to be paid for 60, 120, 180, or 240 Months Certain and thereafter for life.
All Optional Methods of Settlement are actuarially equivalent to the Normal Form of Payment on a
unisex basis based on the UP-1984 Mortality Table adjusted for a 40% female content in the participant
group and the interest rate used by the PBGC for terminating Plans as of the beginning of the plan year.

Effective Date
The most recent amendment reflected in the following plan provisions was effective January 1, 1998.
Effective March 7, 2009, the Plan was frozen to all new entrants and all future accruals.
Covered Employees
Employees who are members in the bargaining unit represented by the United Telegraph Workers of
America, AFL-CIO, and the employment with the company.
Definitions
Vesting Service
All service since date of employment with any affiliated company, excluding a break-in-service.
Accredited Service
All service rendered since date of employment up to March 6, 2009.
Average Monthly Earnings
One twelfth of the average of the highest five consecutive calendar years of pensionable pay. Pay after
March 6, 2009 is not considered.
Social Security Benefit
The projected amount of the participant's primary Social Security benefit according to the law in effect at
the date of termination of employment assuming continuation of the current earnings to age 65.
Normal Retirement Date (NRD)
The date the participant attains age 65.
Normal Retirement Pension
Equals (i) minus (ii) with a minimum of (iii):
i. 1.35% of the average monthly earnings multiplied by years of accredited service less the Western
Union Telegraph Company pension benefits (if any).
ii. For employees who became participants on or after January 1, 1989: 1.3% of the Social Security
benefit multiplied by years of accredited service, but not greater than the maximum offset allowance
permitted by IRS regulators. For employees who became participants prior to January 1, 1989: No
offset.
iii. $300 multiplied by the ratio of accredited service at termination to the greater of 20 years or the
accredited service at normal retirement date.
Pre-Retirement Spouse Benefit
50% of the monthly pension benefit multiplied by the applicable reduction factor for a 50% joint and
survivor pension, and by the applicable early retirement reduction factor.

Benefit Structure Documents
General Dynamics Salaried Retirement Plan—NASSCO Legacy Provisions and General Dynamics
Salaried Retirement Plan.
Effective Date
January 1, 1969.
Eligibility
Salaried employees of National Steel and Shipbuilding Company.
Closure to New Hires Date
January 1, 2002.
Normal Retirement Date
Age 65. If member has service prior to January 1, 2007, age 62 applicable to benefit based on service
prior to January 1, 2007.
Early Retirement Date
Between ages 55 and 62 after completion of 10 years of continuous service or at any age with years of
age plus continuous service equal to 70 or more.
Normal Retirement Pension
Basic Benefit Formula
A monthly pension as shown below:
i. Service prior to 1/1/2007: 1% of final average compensation per year of credited service, plus 0.5%
of final average compensation in excess of covered compensation per year of credited service up to
a maximum of 35 years.
ii. Service 1/1/2007 to 12/31/2020: 1% of final average pay per year of plan membership service. Plan
membership service is frozen as of December 31, 2020.
For Corporate officers, plan membership service is frozen as of December 31, 2018, or the date they
are named as an officer, if later.
Final average compensation equals the average of the highest consecutive 60 months of total earnings
during the last 120 months of plan membership service. Final average compensation is frozen as of
December 31, 2010.
Covered compensation equals the average of the Social Security taxable wage bases in effect for each
calendar year during the 35 year period ending in the year in which the member attains the Social
Security retirement age. Covered compensation is frozen as of December 31, 2010.
Final average pay equals the average of the highest consecutive 60 monthly base rates of pay (including
100% of incentive compensation) received during the last 120 months of plan membership. For service
accrued from January 1, 2007 to December 31, 2020, final average pay is frozen as of December 31,
2020. For Corporate officers, final average pay is frozen as of December 31, 2018, or the date they are
named as an officer, if later.

General Dynamics Salaried Retirement Plan—Corporate Legacy Provisions
Hourly Employees Retirement Plan
General Dynamics Facilities Employees Retirement Plan
Camden Hourly Employees Retirement Plan
Navajo Hourly Employees Retirement Plan
The following is a brief summary of the provisions of the benefit structures.
Effective Date
Varies by benefit structure.
Eligibility
All employees covered by the applicable benefit structure at the date operations were discontinued or
the business was sold.
Service
Credited service is frozen at the date operations were discontinued or the business was sold. Service
with a successor employer may be considered as continuous service for purposes of determining
eligibility for benefits under the applicable benefit structure.
Normal Retirement Date
Age 65.
Early Retirement Date
Between ages 55 and 65. Benefits payable under final average pay formula of the Salaried benefit
structure or benefits payable under the Facilities or Navajo benefit structures also require completion of
10 years of continuous service.
Disability Retirement Date
Ten years of continuous service. Not applicable for members covered by the Salaried or Facilities
benefit structures.
Normal Retirement Pension
A monthly pension equal to the accrued benefit based on salary, service and benefit levels in effect at
the date operations were discontinued or the business was sold.
